intro: Campanula rapunculus var. strigulosa, commonly known as the rough bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
